data.title: Don't eat at the bar
data.text: The place was full, so decided to eat at the bar.  Our waiter was helpful with our drinks, then finally took our order.  Simple food.  But after a long time, he had disappeared and two women were then working the bar.  We asked them to check on our order. It was brought a bit later.  Most of the food was warm, but it had been sitting under warmers.

data.title: El Toro
data.text: They have their own version of Tex- Mex, judging from the many years in business they must be doing something right the restaurant has been here as long as I can remember. They have a small chain with three locations in Baytown. The Decker Drive and Bayway Drive being a lot older, the new Flagship is 5810 Garth Road, they have locations in Palestine Texas, Clute and La Porte. I like the new one but the old Decker site is to me like the original Ninfa's, I just enjoy going there. I have visited for well over 40 years (I think they opened in the 60's). Food and service are consistent thru out the chain, I think the Palestine location is the only one I that have not been. Try their green sauce my favorite has always been the combo plates.

data.title: Excellent Food and Service
data.text: El Toro is a Baytown institution that has been serving great Mexican food for many years. Excellent fajitas and the green sauce is the best.

data.title: Some of everything please
data.text: Whether a visitor into town or a regular some of the best Mexican food in Baytown! Have to try the fresh guacamole and queso and the the fajitas are fantastic, the environment is wonderful always very clean and wait staff very pleasant!

data.title: Food leaves something to be desired
data.text:
We visited the El Toro on Decker Drive a couple of months ago. We ordered the seafood enchiladas. They are NOT seafood enchiladas; they pour a seafood sauce over cheese enchiladas. The enchiladas were cold and the tortillas were hard.

Today we gave the El Toro on Garth Road a try. We ordered chicken enchiladas. The chicken was in big chunks and watery. The cheese on top had been melted and re-hardened by the time we got the plates. The beans were watery.

We will not visit El Toro restaurants again.

data.title: Poor Service, dirty tables
data.text:
El Toro has several locations. We went to the one on Decker Drive because the one on Garth Rd. is VERY loud. And, even if they are not busy service is poor at best.
We visted at 1pm and their was no one to seat us. We walked around the corner and saw somewho who told us to seat ourselves. We went to 5 tables before we found one that had been cleaned. The dishes were gone but the tabletops were dirty. We ordered the shrimp and chicken. The shrimp were tough and dry (cheap tasting). And there was only enough chicken to make 1 taco? 13 bucks for a couple of dry shrimp and 1 chicken taco (it came with beans no rice).  I only had the chicken and there was not  much on my plate either. Just lots of onions. The chicken tasted OK to me, but for a lot less money we could have gone to taco bell.  We have been eating at El Toro's since the 1970's.  I do not know if we will go back.

data.title: Regular
data.text: La atención es regular y se tardan en traer la comida y bueno a comible no esta mal pero tampoco buena buena, pero se pasa un rato diferente
